name: 1.1 - Check current drawings are used on site for works
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, CEMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, CEMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS,
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A qualified Ecologist is or trained wildlife handler to be present during removal of native vegetation; has provided advice on alternative fauna habitat sites if applicable and be present on the site during any relocation works if required.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Construction Environmental Management Plan Appendix 2
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: VicRoads has already obtained permits and/or approvals to disturb flora/fauna sites. Ensure that a copy of these permits are obtained prior to the commencement of tree removal works.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The work area has been determined, and the extent of clear and grub has been reviewed by Fulton Hogan and the Superintendent. Any trees to be removed have been clearly marked and confirmed on site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.2 - Cultural Heritage and Areas of Significance
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Areas determined to be No-Go Zones are securely fenced and clearly identified by signage installed in the fencing.
○ Works are to be suspended immediately and Cultural Heritage representatives (BLCAC) are to be notified, if any items of significance are discovered or identified during construction.
○ Works may recommence with the cultural heritage approval or if works can resume without risk to the discovered Cultural Heritage.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.3 - Joint Inspection to Mark vegetation or habitat to be removed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to removing any vegetation or habitat, the Contractor shall arrange an on-site inspection with the project Arborist and project Ecologist
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings CEMP Tree Management Plan 176.I1
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trees shall be brought down in such manner as to avoid danger to personnel and traffic or damage to other trees, shrubs, structures or property outside the area being cleared or designated to be retained within the area being cleared
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Any holes produced from grubbing operations have been backfilled with similar material and compacted
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trees that are to be removed shall be mulched to the extent possible and the mulch retained for use in the Landscaping Works.
○ Noxious weeds shall not be mulched.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.7 - Dispose of concrete, bituminous and other recyclable materials.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Salvaged concrete, bituminous materials over 50mm and other recyclable materials have been sent to approved recycling establishments.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior and after commencement of any ground disturbing activities

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Topsoil shall be stripped for the full width of the formation.Declared noxious weeds, pests and pathogens shall be treated and monitored before stripping of topsoil, and after spreading, to prevent and/or minimise the spread of weeds and other pathogens throughout the site.
○ Stockpiles shall be maintained in a neat, well shaped state capable of shedding water. Topsoil shall be re-spread as soon as practicable.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pits which are no longer required shall be removed or broken back to a depth not less than 0.3 m below the finished surface of the subgrade. Remaining pipe openings shall be sealed with concrete. Any remnants of pits shall be backfilled with material and compacted to a density ratio of not less than 95%. The calculation of density ratio shall be based on Standard compactive effort.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Clearing work shall not be undertake outside of the specified limits of work.

○ Tree branches extending over the carriageway shall be trimmed to provide a clearance of at least 6 m above the carriageway surface. Where whole branches are to be removed, the three cut method shall be used.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior and after commencement of any ground disturbing activities

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed or grubbed to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the subgrade and batters, whichever is the lesser treatment. In areas to be covered by embankments, to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the stripped surface or not less than 0.6 m below the finished surface of the subgrade, whichever is the lesser treatment.
○ Holes resulting from grubbing shall be backfilled with material similar to the surrounding material and compacted to the same degree as the surrounding material
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: CEMP VicRoads Spec. Cl.201.05
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All personnel on site have completed site specific induction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, CEMP, TMP & SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, CEMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS,
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Current Excavation Permit signed and specific for the area where works will be executed.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Excavation Permit No.
1.4 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
1.5 - Confirm understanding of current CEMP and CHMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All environmental measures and site controls to be implemented as per current CEMP and CHMP. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings CEMP, CHMP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: In areas where excavation will be made, all vegetation, refuse and obstructions shall be totally grubbed or grubbed to a depth of not less than 0.3 m below the subgrade and batters, whichever is the lesser treatment.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.201.05, ITP-001
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placing fill shall not commence on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to construction of the regulating layer, the areas of rock subgrade shall be presented to the Superintendent for acceptance.
○ Details of any necessary amendments to the sub surface drainage design including trasverse subsurface drainage at the interfaces shall be submitted to the Superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Superintendent shall be notified where groundwater or seepage is encountered and the proposed action to be taken, shall be submitted for review. Any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for treatment and disposal of this groundwater shall also be submitted .
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where unsuitable material is encountered, actions shall be:
a) excavate the unsuitable material and backfill with 20mm Class 3 Crushed rock and compacted to min 98% Standard MDD to the approval of Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all Works meet level and location requirements. Verification of conformity with latest IFC drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey records & pegs on the ground
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Geotextiles / fabrics placed as per manufacturers specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check correct documentation is being utilized (latest drawing revision) and IFC/ Proof Engineering
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Current revision of drawing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Current revision of drawing
FREQUENCY: No less than 4 weeks prior to commencement of activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mix design reviewed and approved by superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: VicRoads letter of approval
FREQUENCY: No less than 4 weeks prior to commencement of activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proposed materials and pile construction procedures reviewed by the superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: VicRoads letter of approval
1.4 - Ensure Traffic, Safety, Quality and Environmental management measures are in place
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of activity. EMP at least 2 weeks prior
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Safety plan, traffic management plan and environmental management plan
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Ensure all measures in place as per plan
1.5 - Certification of approved Hot Dip Galvanising
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Galvanising treatment in accordance with appropriate Standard documents and Design specification 200 microns
FREQUENCY: Prior to arrival on site
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Epoxy treatment in accordance with appropriate Standard documents and Design specification
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey and confirm position and depth as per drawing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check the excavation levels and base are acceptable and conform to the drawing prior to commencement of piling works.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Drilling check sheet

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: First 3 piles to be inspected by Geotechnical Engineer to check dimensions and toe level are correct and within tolerance. Correct Toe level. Material encountered consistent with design.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bore logs and pile installation records to be sent to and reviewed by designer
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Drilling check sheet
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Spacers/supports to be placed along steel reinforcement at a maximum 2m intervals
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.6 - Inspection of column and cage height and centre
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure heights, centre and spacing of reinforcement cage and column are in accordance with drawings and within tolerance
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to each concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Relevant ITPs and Quality Control checklists completed and reviewed
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sampling in accordance with 610.16 Slump: As per VR450/50 mix 675mm (+/- 125mm), (550mm - 800mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete cyclinder test smples: 7 day concrete strength achieved of 35MPa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete cyclinder test smples: 7 day concrete strength achieved of 50MPa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
3.6 - Tolerance Check and As Built Survey
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check tolerances and survey pile positions. Mark all details correctly on as-builts. Pile head position and verticality
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
